subject: Don't hardcode overcloud stack name.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-20 14:21:35.000000000', 'files': ['templates/workload_launch.sh.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/commit/4af3f29c7d173eba5e099aee03c15f3b26c2593e', 'message': "Don't hardcode overcloud stack name.

When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 credentials file(s) would reflect that.
E.g: when overcloud is called 'qe-cloud' credential files are:
  qe-cloudrc and qe-cloudrc.v3
This chage introduces new variable 'overcloud_stack_name'
 (default is 'overcloud') and adjusts paths to credentials files,
to be derived from stack's name.

Change-Id: I75dab2a85d94eb7fd012cd25a3e89720984c25e2
"}]
commit_message:
Don't hardcode overcloud stack name.

When overcloud is deployed with other name than 'overcloud',
 credentials file(s) would reflect that.
E.g: when overcloud is called 'qe-cloud' credential files are:
  qe-cloudrc and qe-cloudrc.v3
This chage introduces new variable 'overcloud_stack_name'
 (default is 'overcloud') and adjusts paths to credentials files,
to be derived from stack's name.

Change-Id: I75dab2a85d94eb7fd012cd25a3e89720984c25e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/62/546162/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # overcloud stack name overcloud_stack_name: "overcloud" overcloud_rc: "{{ working_dir }}/{{ overcloud_stack_name }}rc"

commit_message:
Add missing sleep to healthmanager failover proc

This process has been spinning out of control with no sleeps, eating CPU
and negatively impacting the rest of the HM functionality.

Change-Id: If5db60535f0b0e8089fa06bdb9a1dbb6f3f3237a

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: If31aa24f74db73ab925f6568d3c8653228b6e9c6

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iff4a4831b0aeb60afde2b3999a775af8bec16918

commit_message:
Detach volumes when deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

If the user creates a volume-backed server from an existing
volume, the API reserves the volume by creating an attachment
against it. This puts the volume into 'attaching' status.

If the user then deletes the server before it's created in a
cell, by deleting the build request, the attached volume is
orphaned and requires admin intervention in the block storage
service.

This change simply pulls the BDMs off the BuildRequest when
we delete the server via the build request and does the same
local cleanup of those volumes as we would in a "normal" local
delete scenario that the instance was created in a cell but
doesn't have a host.

We don't have to worry about ports in this scenario since
ports are created on the compute, in a cell, and if we're
deleting a build request then we never got far enough to
create ports.

Change-Id: I1a576bdb16befabe06a9728d7adf008fc0667077
Partial-Bug: #1404867
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/32/545132/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We need to detach from any volumes so they aren't orphaned. self._local_cleanup_bdm_volumes( build_req.block_device_mappings, instance, context) # If we're cleaning up volumes from an instance that wasn't yet # created in a cell, i.e. the user deleted the server while # the BuildRequest still existed, then the BDM doesn't actually # exist in the DB to destroy it. if 'id' in bdm: bdm.destroy()

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib70ca225c0bd18bcb45076449f73d5dacbce7e9e

subject: Add functional recreate test of deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-15 21:05:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7bddab11f7f077e61fde72d5aafdf5d607940914', 'message': "Add functional recreate test of deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

This is another wrinkle for bug 1404867 where we create a
volume-backed server, create an attachment on the volume which
puts the volume in 'attaching' status, and then delete the server
before it's actually scheduled to a cell (or hits the scheduler
and fails to schedule and gets created in cell0).

In this case, the _delete_while_booting code in the compute API
finds and deletes the BuildRequest before the instance was ever
created in a cell, which conductor will find and halt the build
process.

The bug is that _delete_while_booting in the API doesn't also
process block device mappings and unreserve/delete attachments
on the volume, which orphans the volume and can only be fixed
with admin intervention in the block storage service.

Change-Id: Ib65acc671711eae7aee65df9cd5c6b2ccb559f5c
Related-Bug: #1404867

commit_message:
Add functional recreate test of deleting a BFV server pre-scheduling

This is another wrinkle for bug 1404867 where we create a
volume-backed server, create an attachment on the volume which
puts the volume in 'attaching' status, and then delete the server
before it's actually created in a cell.

In this case, the _delete_while_booting code in the compute API
finds and deletes the BuildRequest before the instance was ever
created in a cell.

The bug is that _delete_while_booting in the API doesn't also
process block device mappings and unreserve/delete attachments
on the volume, which orphans the volume and can only be fixed
with admin intervention in the block storage service.

Change-Id: Ib65acc671711eae7aee65df9cd5c6b2ccb559f5c
Related-Bug: #1404867

commit_message:
Add DPDK support for centos and rhel family in ovsdpdk container

Unlike ubuntu, for centos and rhel, a single openvswitch package
is used for with and without dpdk, controlled by run time property
'dpdk-init'. This patch adds the package required for enabling
DPDK with ovs on ovsdpdk container for rhel and centos.

Change-Id: Iad099bac1ba9f6c8f220b02c33304d176b74513e

commit_message:
Create image using 'owner' parameter

This patch is uploaded, since there is a bug report[1],
while trying to create image using 'owner' parameter.
The bug is also occurred in update operation.

NOTE: Create image with owner different from tenant owner by
      using "owner" parameter requires an admin privileges.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1420008/comments/4

Change-Id: I2601f09ca86b7729db644e55121b964e71c1bb3e
Related-Bug: #1420008

commit_message:
Remove nose dependency

Tempest does not work with nose. Remove the nose dependency from
the tempest docker image. All required Tempest python dependencies
are defined in requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I1a0743f14420b5bfddb0f16bbba2f76b22a332e5

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I3bbcbbdd03395c2c6e8ec144527a8253795a1858

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib435234dcd10222d2f2bd3415661bbd4deac8367

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I07604fabdd3be5d26ec6f42a0d1af29234baad95

commit_message:
Reduce code duplication

Reduced source code by extracting duplicated code

Change-Id: I80ea7e372ea5c54ac0c59ff7782b7a391f6eaf78
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/25/476025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def startswith_based_search(search_value, start_ch, match, match_type): if search_value.startswith(start_ch): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match[match_type] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:] return match, search_value def startswith_and_square_brackets_based_search(search_value, match, match_type): if search_value and search_value[0].isdigit(): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] in '0123456789.': i += 1 match[match_type] = search_value[:i] search_value = search_value[i:] elif search_value and search_value.startswith('['): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] != ']': i += 1 i += 1 match[match_type] = search_value[:i].lstrip('[').rstrip(']') search_value = search_value[i:] return match, search_value match, search_value = startswith_based_search(search_value, 'd', match, 'id') match, search_value = startswith_based_search(search_value, 'r', match, 'region') match, search_value = startswith_based_search(search_value, 'z', match, 'zone') match, search_value = startswith_and_square_brackets_based_search( search_value, match, 'ip') match, search_value = startswith_based_search(search_value, ':', match, 'port') match, search_value = startswith_and_square_brackets_based_search( search_value, match, 'replication_ip') match, search_value = startswith_based_search(search_value, 'z', match, 'replication_port')
deleted_lines: if search_value.startswith('d'): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match['id'] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value.startswith('r'): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match['region'] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value.startswith('z'): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match['zone'] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value and search_value[0].isdigit(): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] in '0123456789.': i += 1 match['ip'] = search_value[:i] search_value = search_value[i:] elif search_value and search_value.startswith('['): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] != ']': i += 1 i += 1 match['ip'] = search_value[:i].lstrip('[').rstrip(']') search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value.startswith(':'): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match['port'] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value and search_value[0].isdigit(): i = 1 while (i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] in '0123456789.'): i += 1 match['replication_ip'] = search_value[:i] search_value = search_value[i:] elif search_value and search_value.startswith('['): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i] != ']': i += 1 i += 1 match['replication_ip'] = search_value[:i].lstrip('[').rstrip(']') search_value = search_value[i:] if search_value.startswith(':'): i = 1 while i < len(search_value) and search_value[i].isdigit(): i += 1 match['replication_port'] = int(search_value[1:i]) search_value = search_value[i:]

commit_message:
Rename variable 'db_containers'

The variable 'db_containers' or 'db_container' is ambiguous.
This patch rename the variable to make it clear.

Change-Id: I92eff97f6edd441b7fab89de979bafb2aa70939d
Closes-Bug: #1743353

commit_message:
Generate policy sample file automatically.

A new entrypoint in setup.cfg and a config file are added for
using olso.policy helper script to generate the sample file.

A new tox target also is added to simplify the environment
setting up. Now policy sample file can be generated
automatically, so the in-repo sample file is no longer needed.

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Laski <andrew@lascii.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint policy-in-code
Change-Id: Ic336fa154ccc05b5e9db3a8e751a484b1cc5aa9c
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/66/543366/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
report_root should always use context.user

The RootHistory intends to record by whom and when the root user of the
underlying datastore backend was enabled. So the "user" column should
always be set to the context user, not the actual root user in the
database. But report_root(and report_root_enabled in
taskmanager.models) use the database user instead, this is not correct,
This patch will fix.

Also remove the "user" argument from Root.create() and
HistoryRoot.create() because the context is already passed in as an
argument when these methods are called.

Closes-Bug: #1546372
Change-Id: I3b4c8ee56c7e0876fb384f0c5841d2d391bd555d
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/30/541630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
fs004: add missing deployed_server var

Set deployed_server to true in tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-oooq
job that still run on newton/ocata/pike.

So the job will run the deployed-server scripts as we expect it to do
it.

Change-Id: Ib203161b9676dcfaaf46eec2bddf767ec49282f7
Related-Bug: #1748315
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/97/546297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deployed_server: true

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib717d34791c3e41a1b048806c00da3be9958fdec

subject: Migration support for postgresql
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-16 06:17:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/9719fb56ec64538e04a9771f3d6e9ddeec8175fb', 'message': 'Migration support for postgresql

After recent change in manage command [1] deploying glance with
postgres using stack.sh fails as db_sync internally uses E-M-C
and it has support only for mysql.

Removed check of databse type as current expand, migrate and contract
scripts supports both postgres and mysql with exception that
execution of triggers fails for postgresql.

NOTE:
If your expand or contract script contains any triggers then make
sure those should be executed only for mysql database.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/
Closes-Bug: #1749466

commit_message:
Migration support for postgresql

After recent change in manage command [1] deploying glance with
postgres using stack.sh fails as db_sync internally uses E-M-C
and it has support only for mysql.

Added flag online_migration which will be False in case of
db_sync so that enigne check will be eliminated and True in case
of running expand, migrate, contract to perform validatio check on
engine type.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433934/

Closes-Bug: #1749466
Change-Id: Ifddeff139e212564118520f3150db198ab1c94f4

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic41a4bd4f63e465a06e7ad375abbe462c02aaa12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-zaqar refs/changes/56/546456/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/queens} {opts} {packages}

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ie58ef3f862beff73ccf375027429cd1d855f60a3

subject: Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 23:40:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6c6df4bc2fd53fe05a17c7bf7a4ff8ee13cba6fa', 'message': 'Detach volume after deleting instance with no host

If an instance is booted from a volume, shelved, and goes into an error
state due to some reason, the volume from which instance is booted
remains even the instance is deleted because instance has no host
associated with it.

Called _local_delete() to detach volume and destroy bdm if instance is
in shelved_offloaded state or has no host associated with it. This will
cleanup both volumes and the networks.

Note:
Ankit had submitted same patch [1] earlier which was reverted [2] due
to a race condition on jenkins if an instance is deleted when it is in
building state.  The patch was then resubmitted [3] fixing the
the failure of race condition by reverting the ObjectActionError
exception handling in _delete.  This patch was later re-reverted [4]
due to continued jenkins race conditions.

The patch [5] intended to avoid the jenkins race condition by leaving
the flow for instances in the BUILDING state unchanged and only calling
_local_delete() on instances in the shelved_offloaded or error states
when the instance has no host associated with it. It however also had
to be reverted [6] because of yet another race condition.

The patch [7] took a more minimal approach of adding the ERROR state
to the logic for doing a local delete plus cleanup of resources on
a compute host. But it ended up being reverted [8] because it made an
assumption that instances in ERROR state have no host set, when this
is not necessarily the case. A particular tempest test uses reset-state
to put an instance into ERROR state before deletion and with the patch,
this did a local delete and was suspected of causing failures in the
postgres tempest job.

This version removes the assumption about instances in ERROR state
and checks the instance.host to make the decision about whether
to query service up to determine whether to local delete.

[1] Ic630ae7d026a9697afec46ac9ea40aea0f5b5ffb
[2] Id4e405e7579530ed1c1f22ccc972d45b6d185f41
[3] Ic107d8edc7ee7a4ebb04eac58ef0cdbf506d6173
[4] Ibcbe35b5d329b183c4d0e8233e8ada26ebc512c2
[5] I928a397c75b857e94bf5c002e50ec43a2bed9848
[6] I6b9b886e0d6f2ec86141c048fb50969bccf5cb30
[7] I2192ef513a2cd15d21e9d5d5fe22c5a5fbae0941
[8] I0ed184b579b8a8d861e4d2a7c317bf0bc0623d50

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117

the failure of race condition by reverting the ObjectActionError
exception handling in _delete.  This patch was later re-reverted [4]
due to continued jenkins race conditions.

The patch [5] intended to avoid the jenkins race condition by leaving
the flow for instances in the BUILDING state unchanged and only calling
_local_delete() on instances in the shelved_offloaded or error states
when the instance has no host associated with it. It however also had
to be reverted [6] because of yet another race condition.

The patch [7] took a more minimal approach of adding the ERROR state
to the logic for doing a local delete plus cleanup of resources on
a compute host. But it ended up being reverted [8] because it made an
assumption that instances in ERROR state have no host set, when this
is not necessarily the case. A particular tempest test uses reset-state
to put an instance into ERROR state before deletion and with the patch,
this did a local delete and was suspected of causing failures in the
postgres tempest job.

This version removes the assumption about instances in ERROR state
and checks the instance.host to make the decision about whether
to query service up to determine whether to local delete.

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2018-01-30 00:20:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d9366c82d9c6a410844758117f856b16f8aae9f7', 'message': 'Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None, vm_state = ERROR, and ports
and volumes still allocated on the compute host (if the instance had
networking and volumes).

Ideally, in this case, we would want to do a terminate instance over
RPC to have the compute node clean up the instance and its ports and
volumes. But we no longer know the instance.host because the compute
manager set it to None.

So, the best we can do is run through the "local delete" routine in the
compute api to delete the instance record from the database and free up
ports and volumes. Then, when the reap task runs on the compute host
the instance virt domain lives on, it will detect that the instance
record has been deleted from the database and will clean up the
orphaned virt domain.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when we expect
instance.host to be None.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we expect
     instance.host to be None even though there could be ports and
     volumes allocated. In this case, run through the _local_delete
     routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the instance
     database record. Note that instances in this situation will still
     have vifs plugged and volumes attached at the virt domain level
     and will not be cleaned up until the next periodic reap task
     interval fires.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527
Closes-Bug: 1594604

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117

end up with an instance with host = None, vm_state = ERROR, and ports
and volumes still allocated on the compute host (if the instance had

manager set it to None.

compute api to delete the instance record from the database and free up
ports and volumes. Then, when the reap task runs on the compute host
the instance virt domain lives on, it will detect that the instance
record has been deleted from the database and will clean up the
orphaned virt domain.

     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or

     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return.

     instance.host to be None even though there could be ports and
     volumes allocated. In this case, run through the _local_delete
     routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the instance
     database record. Note that instances in this situation will still
     have vifs plugged and volumes attached at the virt domain level
     and will not be cleaned up until the next periodic reap task
     interval fires.

commit_message:
Clean up ports and volumes when deleting ERROR instance

Usually, when instance.host = None, it means the instance was never
scheduled. However, the exception handling routine in compute manager
[1] will set instance.host = None and set instance.vm_state = ERROR
if the instance fails to build on the compute host. If that happens, we
end up with an instance with host = None and vm_state = ERROR which may
have ports and volumes still allocated.

This adds some logic around deleting the instance when it may have
ports or volumes allocated.

  1. If the instance is not in ERROR or SHELVED_OFFLOADED state, we
     expect instance.host to be set to a compute host. So, if we find
     instance.host = None in states other than ERROR or
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we consider the instance to have failed
     scheduling and not require ports or volumes to be freed, and we
     simply destroy the instance database record and return. This is
     the "delete while booting" scenario.

  2. If the instance is in ERROR because of a failed build or is
     SHELVED_OFFLOADED, we expect instance.host to be None even though
     there could be ports or volumes allocated. In this case, run the
     _local_delete routine to clean up ports and volumes and delete the
     instance database record.

Co-Authored-By: Ankit Agrawal <ankit11.agrawal@nttdata.com>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel Matzek <smatzek@us.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: 1404867
Closes-Bug: 1408527

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/55ea961/nova/compute/manager.py#L1927-L1929

Change-Id: I4dc6c8bd3bb6c135f8a698af41f5d0e026c39117
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/340614/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(melwitt): We expect instances in certain states to possibly # have no host set, yet have resources on a compute host. If this # is the case, we want to try to clean up their resources. # Otherwse, we can destroy the instance here and return. expect_instance_host = self._expect_host(instance) if not instance.host and expect_instance_host: except exception.ObjectActionError as ex: # The instance's host likely changed under us as # this instance could be building and has since been # scheduled. Continue with attempts to delete it. # NOTE(melwitt): Often instance.host is None after the # refresh because the claim was aborted on the compute # host. LOG.debug('Refreshing instance because: %s', ex, instance=instance) if instance.host is not None: LOG.debug('Compute host %s not found during service up check, ' 'going to local delete instance', instance.host, instance=instance) def _expect_host(self, instance): # NOTE(melwitt): It is possible for instances in ERROR state to have # their host and node set to None as part of exception handling. if instance.vm_state in (vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED, vm_states.ERROR): return False return True except Exception as exc: err_str = _LW("Ignoring volume cleanup failure due to %s") LOG.warn(err_str % exc, instance=instance) # This block handles the following case: # 1. Instance scheduled to host and fails on the host. # 2. Compute manager's cleanup calls terminate_connection # and detach if the spawn made it that far. # 3. Instance fails to boot on all other reschedule attempts. # 4. Instance is left in error state with no assigned host. # 5. Volumes in the instance's BDMs are left in the available # state. # When this is the case the terminate_connection and detach # calls above will fail. We attempt the volume delete in a # separate try-except to clean up these volume and avoid the # storage leak. try:
deleted_lines: shelved_offloaded = (instance.vm_state == vm_states.SHELVED_OFFLOADED) if not instance.host and not shelved_offloaded: except exception.ObjectActionError: if not shelved_offloaded:

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I725ba6c4d5c7385ce671b2424599ae005a44a6fa

commit_message:
Remove inner_exceptions plumbing

We've finally gotten out of the business of wrapping exceptions. Since
we don't do that anymore, we don't need the log_inner_exceptions logic.

Change-Id: Id1f709daa2e61c13efeeeffc2a08578c27265e56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/53/546253/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param bool log_inner_exceptions: Ignored. Exists for backwards compat.
deleted_lines: :param bool log_inner_exceptions: Send wrapped exceptions to the error log. Defaults to false, because there are a number of wrapped exceptions that are noise for normal usage. It's possible that for a user that has python logging configured properly, it's desirable to have all of the wrapped exceptions be emitted to the error log. This flag will enable that behavior. if log_inner_exceptions: OpenStackCloudException.log_inner_exceptions = True

commit_message:
Make meta.find_best_address() more generic

This function now can choose address family with socket.getaddrinfo()
method and there is no need to pass address family as argument to it.

Change-Id: I72b1c1263876f2d047e5e540b72f2550ec73b65c
Story: 2001475
Task: 6213
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/52/546252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: addrs, public=public, cloud_public=cloud_public)def find_best_address(addresses, public=False, cloud_public=True): for res in socket.getaddrinfo( address, 22, socket.AF_UNSPEC, socket.SOCK_STREAM, 0): family, socktype, proto, _, sa = res connect_socket = socket.socket(family, socktype, proto) connect_socket.settimeout(1) connect_socket.connect(sa) return address return find_best_address(addresses, public=True)
deleted_lines: addrs, socket.AF_INET, public=public, cloud_public=cloud_public)def find_best_address(addresses, family, public=False, cloud_public=True): connect_socket = socket.socket(family, socket.SOCK_STREAM, 0) connect_socket.settimeout(1) if family == socket.AF_INET4: connect_socket.connect((address, 22)) else: connect_socket.connect((address, 22, 0, 0)) return address return find_best_address(addresses, socket.AF_INET6, public=True)

commit_message:
Fix address format used in find_best_address()

The current implementation only works for IPv6 addresses, for IPv4
addresses the connect() call always produces an exception because the
address format is wrong. We need to use the format matching the address
family that is being used.

Change-Id: Ida5099278363dc4a527bb488c83883a1d2377f6b
Story: 2001475
Task: 6195
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/51/546251/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add supported method for checking the network exts

It is useful for operators to be able to check if a cloud supports
certain extensions to know whether they can perform some API actions.

Change-Id: Ie99668173d4dc6e6b3992e496560b5b7598181a2
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/50/546250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_network_extensions(self): """Get Cloud provided network extensions :returns: set of Neutron extension aliases """ return self._neutron_extensions()

commit_message:
Fix get_server to work with use_direct_get

servers are different and are avoinding the underlying infrastructure.
Update the server methods to work right.

Change-Id: I1d783093084ad2bf05527980a61de95ec5a9ae31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/48/546248/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.use_direct_get: searchfunc = functools.partial(self.get_server_by_id, bare=True) else: searchfunc = functools.partial(self.search_servers, detailed=detailed, bare=True, all_projects=all_projects) def get_server_by_id( self, id=None, detailed=False, bare=False, all_projects=False): """Get a server by ID. :param id: ID of the server. :param detailed: Whether or not to add detailed additional information. Defaults to False. :param bare: Whether to skip adding any additional information to the server record. Defaults to False, meaning the addresses dict will be populated as needed from neutron. Setting to True implies detailed = False. :param all_projects: Whether to get server from all projects or just the current auth scoped project. :returns: A server ``munch.Munch`` or None if no matching server is found. """ params = {} if all_projects: params['all_tenants'] = True data = self._compute_client.get( '/servers/{id}'.format(id=id), params=params) return self._expand_server( self._normalize_server(server), detailed=detailed, bare=bare)
deleted_lines: searchfunc = functools.partial(self.search_servers, detailed=detailed, bare=True, all_projects=all_projects) def get_server_by_id(self, id): data = self._compute_client.get('/servers/{id}'.format(id=id)) return meta.add_server_interfaces(self, self._normalize_server(server))

commit_message:
Plumb use-direct-get through factory functions

It's a parameter to the cloud -so it should be in the factory functions.

Change-Id: I1bba245f524799e132ce7ca73768818ffea8a5e3
